member.name: M:Equations.EquationModule.multiplyDenominatorsAndSubtract(Equations.Equation)
member.summary: convenience function that multiplies by denominator of right and left sides of equation and then subtracts right side ex : a/b = c /d -> a * d = b * c -> a * d - b * c = 0

member.name: T:ProbabilityDistributions.Exponential
member.summary: the exponential distribution is the probability distribution of the time between events in a Poisson point process,

member.name: M:ProbabilityDistributions.Binomial.Prob(MathNet.Symbolics.Expression)
member.summary: Probability of k Heads in n flips each with probability p

member.name: T:ProbabilityDistributions.Binomial
member.summary: From wiki:binomal with distr with parameters n and p is the discrete probability distribution of the number of successes in a sequence of n independent experiments, each asking a yes–no question, and each with its own Boolean-valued outcome: success/yes/true/one (with probability p)

member.name: M:MathNet.Symbolics.Utils.defineStr(MathNet.Symbolics.Expression,MathNet.Symbolics.Expression,System.String)
member.summary: Define with left, right and description

member.name: M:MathNet.Symbolics.Utils.FunctionHelpers.fn(MathNet.Symbolics.Expression,MathNet.Symbolics.Expression)
member.summary: Create a function with symbol, body and default name "f": fn x x^2 = `x |-> x^2`

member.name: M:MathNet.Symbolics.Utils.FunctionHelpers.fx(MathNet.Symbolics.Expression)
member.summary: Create a function with symbol and default name "f": fx y = `f(y)`

member.name: M:MathNet.Symbolics.Utils.FunctionHelpers.func(System.String,MathNet.Symbolics.Expression)
member.summary: Create a function with name and symbol: func "g" y = `g(y)`

member.summary: limited by range of decimal (which is used as a less noisy alternative to floats)

member.summary: eval with numbers or vars with the phrase "Var" in the symbol name are acceptable

member.summary: eval with numbers or vars (optionally) are acceptable

member.name: M:MathNet.Symbolics.Core.Expression.extractNegativeOne(MathNet.Symbolics.Expression)
member.summary: This rewrites the expression in terms of its negation, but multiplies it with -1 so as to keep it equal, effectively pulling out a -1. Useful for cancelling sometimes. Example: -a - b becomes -1 * (a + b) = -(a+b).

member.name: M:MathNet.Symbolics.Core.Expression.cancelAbs(MathNet.Symbolics.Expression)
member.summary: condition: x > 0

member.name: M:MathNet.Symbolics.Logarithm.powerRuleReverse(MathNet.Symbolics.Expression)
member.summary: a * log x -> log(x^a)

member.name: M:MathNet.Symbolics.Logarithm.powerRule(MathNet.Symbolics.Expression)
member.summary: log (x**n) -> n * log x

member.name: M:MathNet.Symbolics.Logarithm.contract(MathNet.Symbolics.Expression)
member.summary: log a + log b + ... -> log (a*b...)

member.name: M:MathNet.Symbolics.Logarithm.expand(MathNet.Symbolics.Expression)
member.summary: log (a * b) -> log a + log b

member.summary: condition: n >= 0

member.name: P:MathNet.Symbolics.Summation.mergeSummationsInSum
member.summary: merge summations in a sum that have the same parameters, eg Σ x + Σ y to Σ (x+y)
